com.joliciel.talismane.filters

Interface TextMarkerFilter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DuplicateWhiteSpaceFilter, NewlineEndOfSentenceMarker, NewlineSpaceMarker, OtherWhiteSpaceFilter, RegexMarkerFilter

    public interface TextMarkerFilter
    A filter applied to a block of raw text and producing a list of text markers.
    Author:
    Assaf Urieli

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Set<TextMarker> apply(String prevText, String text, String nextText)
      Apply the filter to the text (not to prevText or nextText), and detect any text markers.
      String getAttribute()
      If the filter adds a tag, the attribute to add.
      int getBlockSize()
      The maximum size of text that this filter can match (without risking to add only the beginning and not the end, or vice versa).
      String getReplacement()
      If the filter includes text replacement, the replacement string.
      TokenAttribute<?> getValue()
      If the filter adds a tag, the value to add.
      void setReplacement(String replacement) 
      void setTag(String attribute, TokenAttribute<?> value)
      Set the tag added by this filter.

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        Set<TextMarker> apply(String prevText,
                      String text,
                      String nextText)
        Apply the filter to the text (not to prevText or nextText), and detect any text markers.

      • getReplacement

        String getReplacement()
        If the filter includes text replacement, the replacement string.

      • setReplacement

        void setReplacement(String replacement)

      • getBlockSize

        int getBlockSize()
        The maximum size of text that this filter can match (without risking to add only the beginning and not the end, or vice versa). Bigger matches will throw an error.

      • getAttribute

        String getAttribute()
        If the filter adds a tag, the attribute to add.

      • getValue

        TokenAttribute<?> getValue()
        If the filter adds a tag, the value to add.

      • setTag

        void setTag(String attribute,
            TokenAttribute<?> value)
        Set the tag added by this filter.
